metadata.name: Ensure that the --etcd-certfile and --etcd-keyfile arguments are set as appropriate (Automated)
metadata.description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.
metadata.rationale: etcd is a highly-available key value store used by Kubernetes deployments for persistent storage of all of its REST API objects. These objects are sensitive in nature and should be protected by client authentication. This requires the API server to identify itself to the etcd server using a client certificate and key.
metadata.audit:
Run the following command on the control plane node:
```
ps -ef | grep kube-apiserver
```
Verify that the `--etcd-certfile` and `--etcd-keyfile` arguments exist and they are set as
appropriate.
metadata.remediation:
Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set up the TLS connection between
the
apiserver and etcd. Then, edit the API server pod specification file
`/etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml` on the control plane node and set the etcd
certificate and key file parameters.
```
--etcd-certfile=<path/to/client-certificate-file>
--etcd-keyfile=<path/to/client-key-file>
```
metadata.impact: TLS and client certificate authentication must be configured for etcd.
metadata.default_value: By default, `--etcd-certfile` and `--etcd-keyfile` arguments are not set
